intro: Diosma rubra var. chlorocalyx, commonly known as the green-leafed diosma, is a perennial herb native to specific regions of North America. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in umbels, typical of its family. Its leaves are notably lighter green compared to other varieties of Diosma, giving it its common name. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland or streamside habitats.
